contextId.information: This means to count the men by recording their names. AT: "Count them, recording each man's name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Count them by name

contextId.information: This number includes all of the men in the tribes that camped under the standard of Judah. AT: "The number of the men camped under the standard of Judah is 186,400" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: All the number of the camp of Judah is 186,400

contextId.information: This number includes all of the men in the tribes that camped under the standard of Reuben. AT: "The number of all the men camped under the standard of Reuben, according to their divisions, is 151,450" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: All those numbered in the camp of Reuben, according to their divisions, is 151,450

contextId.information: This number includes all of the men in the tribes that camped under the standard of Ephraim. AT: "The number of the men camped under the standard of Ephraim is 108,100" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: All those numbered in the camp of Ephraim is 108,100

contextId.information: The this refers to the divisions of Dan, Asher, and Naphthali that are under the standard of Dan. AT: "the divisions that camp under the standard of Dan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the divisions of the camp of Dan

contextId.information: This number includes all of the men in the tribes that camped under the standard of Dan. AT: "The number of the men camped under the standard of Dan is 157,600" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: All those numbered in the camp with Dan is 157,600

contextId.information: This refers to when they would travel to another place. AT: "When they traveled, they went out from the camp" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They went out from the camp

contextId.information: Yahweh was commanding Moses to only count the male descendants. AT: "Count the male descendants" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Count the descendants

contextId.information: This is the east side of the tabernacle. AT: "on the east side, where the sun rises" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: toward the sunrise

contextId.information: This means that the shekel must weight the same as those in the sanctuary. AT: "You must use the weight of the shekels in the sanctuary as your stand weight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must use the shekel of the sanctuary as your standard weight

contextId.information: The poles were inserted into rings on the sides of the ark so that the poles could be used to carry the ark. This can be stated clearly. AT: "insert the poles into the rings on the ark's sides" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: insert the poles

contextId.information: This bread represents the presence of Yahweh. AT: "the bread of Yahweh's presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the bread of the presence

contextId.information: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "bowls and jars used to pour out drink offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: bowls, and jars for pouring

contextId.information: The poles were inserted into rings on the corners of the table so that the poles could be used to carry the table. This can be stated clearly. AT: "insert poles into the rings at the corners of the table" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: insert poles

contextId.information: The poles were inserted into rings on the sides of the altar so theys could be used to carry it. This can be stated clearly. AT: "insert the carrying poles into the rings one the sides of the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: insert the carrying poles

contextId.information: The poles were inserted into rings on the sides of the altar so they could be used to carry it. This can be stated clearly. AT: "insert the carrying poles into the rings on the sides of the altar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: insert the carrying poles

contextId.information: This refers only to men. AT: "of the male descendants of Gershon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: of the descendants of Gershon

contextId.information: This is an outer covering  that is placed on top of the tent of meeting's covering. AT: "the covering of sea cow skin that is placed on top of that" or "the outer covering made of sea cow skin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the covering of sea cow skin that is on it

contextId.information: This refers only to men. AT: "the male descendants of Merari" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the descendants of Merari

contextId.information: The refers to men. AT: "the male descendants of the Kohathites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the descendants of the Kohathites

contextId.information: Here the word "would" does not mean that the men "chose" to join the company but rather that they were "assigned" to the company. AT: "everyone who was assigned to join the company" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: everyone who would join the company

contextId.information: This refers to the men. AT: "The male descendants of Gershon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The descendants of Gershon

contextId.information: Here the word "would" does not mean that the men "chose" to join the company but rather that they were "assigned" to the company. AT: "everyone who was assigned to join the company" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: everyone who would join the company

contextId.information: Here the word "would" does not mean that the men "chose" to join the company but rather that they were "assigned" to the company. AT: "everyone who was assigned to join the company" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: everyone who would join the company

contextId.information: This refers to men. AT: "men from thirty to fifty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: from thirty to fifty

contextId.information: This means that they sent the unclean people away. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "The people of Israel sent those who were unclean out of the camp" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The people of Israel did so

contextId.information: If someone sins against another person, it means that they have also sinned against Yahweh and Yahweh considers that person as unfaithful to him. AT: "they have also wronged me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and is unfaithful to me

contextId.information: Usually the wronged person would receive the payment but if that person has died the payment goes to the closest relative. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "But if the wronged person has died and has no close relative to receive the payment" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: But if the wronged person has no close relative to receive the payment

contextId.information: This means that she is unfaithful to her husband and and sins against him by sleeping with another man. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "sins against her husband by sleeping with another man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: sins against her husband

contextId.information: This refers to the act of adultery. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "in the act of adultery" or "sleeping with him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: in the act

contextId.information: "in the presence of Yahweh." The priest would bring her near the altar. AT: "near the altar and place her in the presence of Yahweh" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: near and place her before Yahweh

contextId.information: Here the "sin" refers specifically to committing adultery. The meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "committed adultery" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: committed a sin

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "then she will not be cursed" or 2) "then she is free from guilt." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: then she must be free

contextId.information: The man is to bring the lamb to the priest so that it can be sacrificed. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "He must bring a male lamb one year old to the priest as a guilt offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He must bring a male lamb ... as a guilt offering

contextId.information: He must bring his offering to the priest to be sacrificed to Yahweh. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "He must present his offering to Yahweh by bringing it to the priest to be sacrificed" or "He must present his offering to Yahweh by bringing it to the priest who will sacrifice it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He must present his offering to Yahweh

contextId.information: The word "their" refers to the other offerings that the Nazirite man was told to bring. Often grain offerings and drink offerings were required to accompany other types of sacrifices. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "together with the grain offering and drink offering that Yahweh required to accompany the other offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: together with their grain offering and drink offerings

contextId.information: This refers to the Nazirite deciding to give other offering beyond what he has been commanded to give. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "If he decides to give any additional offerings" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Whatever else he may give

contextId.information: This means that they gave their offerings to Yahweh and brought them to the tabernacle. These phrases may be combined to add clarity. AT: "They brought their offerings to Yahweh and presented them to him in front of the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They brought their offerings before Yahweh ... They presented these things in front of the tabernacle

contextId.information: You can make explicit the implicit meaning of what belongs to Yahweh. AT: "the things that Yahweh reserved for the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the things that belong to Yahweh

contextId.information: Yahweh repeats these things to emphasize their importance. This must happen before the Levites go to serve at the tent of meeting. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "But first, you must purify them. You must offer them as a wave offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must purify them. You must offer them as a wave offering

contextId.information: The word "fixed" means "previously set." This means that this is when the observe it every year. AT: "Let the people ... at the time of year they currently observe it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Let the people ... at its fixed time of year

contextId.information: This is the set time of year that they celebrate the Passover. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "On the fourteenth day ... and observe it, for this is the time you do celebrate it every year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: On the fourteenth day ... at its fixed time of year

contextId.information: This implies that they touched the dead man, which made them unclean. You can make clear the full meaning of this statement. AT: "became unclean because they touched the body of a dead man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: became unclean by the body of a dead man

contextId.information: This means that they had touched a dead man's body. You can make the full meaning of this statement clear. AT: "because we have touched the body of a dead man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: because of the dead body of a man

contextId.information: This refers to Mount Sinai. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "Mount Sinai, the mountain of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the mountain of Yahweh

contextId.information: This refers to people. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "many tens of thousands of people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: many tens of thousands

contextId.information: What Joshua might have been jealous about can be stated clearly if needed. AT: "Are you concerned that they might be taking away something that belongs to me?" or "Are you concerned that people will not respect my authority?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Are you jealous for my sake?

contextId.information: The relationship between between Joseph and Manasseh can be stated clearly. AT:  "from the tribe of Joseph's son Manasseh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: from the tribe of Joseph (that is to say, from the tribe Manasseh)

contextId.information: This probably means that they will no longer exist. AT: "they will come to an end" or "they will all be destroyed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: They will be completely cut off

contextId.information: "He must act as you act in Yahweh's presence. Because it says that they must act as the Israelites in Yahweh's presence, it is implied that they must obey all of Yahweh's commands. AT: "he must act as you act and obey all of  Yahweh's commands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: He must act as you act before Yahweh

contextId.information: What they should not approach can be stated clearly. AT: "who approaches the sacred things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who approaches

contextId.information: That he must kill the animals first can be stated clearly. AT: "You must kill them and sprinkle their blood" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must sprinkle their blood

contextId.information: How Moses showed that he did not trust and honor God can be stated clearly. AT: "Because you did not trust me or honor me as holy in the eyes of the people of Israel, but struck the rock instead of speaking to it as I told you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Because you did not trust me or honor me as holy in the eyes of the people of Israel

contextId.information: Since it is impossible for Moses to make a real snake, it is implied that he was to make a model of a snake. This implied information can be made clear. AT: "Make a model of a snake" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Make a snake

contextId.information: A scepter was carried by those with authority, and the staff was carried by everyone. Neither of these are digging tools. These two items emphasize that they were not too proud to use any means available. AT: "using even their scepter and staffs" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: with the scepter and their staffs

contextId.information: A sword is drawn from its sheath in order to be ready to use. AT: "with his sword ready to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: with his drawn sword

contextId.information: A sword is drawn from its sheath in order to be ready to use. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:num:22:21|22:23]]. AT: "with his sword ready to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: with his drawn sword

contextId.information: It has already been stated that he killed these animals as a burnt offering. AT: "I have killed a bull and a ram and burnt them as an offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: I have offered up a bull and a ram

contextId.information: It is understood that this wilderness was where Israel was camped. AT: "which looks down on the wilderness where Israel was" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: which looks down on the wilderness

contextId.information: They were only to count the men, not the women. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "Count all the men of the community" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Count all the community

contextId.information: The word "these" refers to all of the men descended from Joseph's sons, Ephraim and Manasseh. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "These were Joseph's descendants, descended from his sons Manasseh and Ephraim," (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: These were Joseph's descendants

contextId.information: In this passage, the word "inheritance" refers to land inherited. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "give more land as an inheritance" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: give more inheritance

contextId.information: The people in the company of Korah gathered together and rebelled against Yahweh. Yahweh caused them to die, because of their sin. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "who died because they were among Korah's followers who rebelled against Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: who conspired against Yahweh in the company of Korah

contextId.information: This means that they will be inherit land where their father's relatives are inheriting land. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "where their father's relatives live" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: among their father's relatives

contextId.information: This refers to an event when Yahweh made water miraculously flow out of a rock. God told Moses to speak to the rock. Instead, Moses hit the rock because he was angry with the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: when the water flowed from the rock, in your anger

contextId.information: This sentence describes the drink offering that is to accompany the lamb. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "It must be a drink offering of strong drink and you must pour it out in the holy place to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must pour out in the holy place a drink offering of strong drink to Yahweh

contextId.information: Many offerings had a drink offering that was required to be offered with them. The full meaning of the can be made clear. AT: "the drink offering that accompanies it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the drink offering with it

contextId.information: This refers to a married woman. You can make the meaning of this statement clear. AT: "If a married woman makes a vow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: If a woman made a vow in her husband's house

contextId.information: This means that he will be guilty of her sin instead of her if she does not fulfill her vow. The full meaning of this statement can be made clear. AT: "if she does not fulfill her vow, she will not be guilty of her sin, and he will be guilty instead of her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: then he will be responsible for her sin

contextId.information: You can make it clear that they will cross over the Jordan. AT: "will cross over the Jordan River" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: will cross over

contextId.information: You can make it clear that they will cross the Jordan. AT: "We will cross over the Jordan ready to fight" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: We will cross over armed

contextId.information: This refers to the firstborn sons. AT: "their firstborn sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: their firstborn

contextId.information: This means if the community judges that the death was accidental then they must save the accused man from the relative who wants to kill him. If the community judges that the death was not accidental, then the relative must execute the accused man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: The community must rescue the accused

contextId.information: This implied that the man would have left the city of refuge and returned home. AT: "You must not ... allow him to leave the city of refuge and return home to live on his own property" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: You must not ... allow him to reside on his own property

contextId.information: This refers to a celebration which happens once every fifty years. In this celebration, all land that someone sold or traded must return to the original owner. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the year of Jubilee of the people
